column2: This sample shows how to implement an audio media app that works across multiple form factors and provide a consistent user experience on Android phones, tablets, Auto, Wear and Cast devices

Fix playback in Automotive.

This change switches to using the new `registerCustomCommandReceiver` in

having to override the PlaybackPreparer and not interrupting the
MediaSession extension from working properly.

Framework for AAE extensions.

This lays the groundwork for Android Auto Embedded extensions in
UAMP. Specifically this will allow supporting login/logout with
the AAE client, which has a specific API response required
to begin authentication that isn't common to the mobile app,
and isn't used by the Android Auto app.

Change-Id: If6e6557c6aa219db2e6f04359e15752c06b32324

Migrate to AndroidX.

This change updates the compile and target SDK to 28, and migrates
the project to use AndroidX in place of the Support Library.

This change does _not_ include updates to handle certificate
key rotation (added in Android Pie/API 28), and so it still uses
the deprecated APIs to fetch the signature of a package.

If you need to support key rotation, you'll need to update the code
in `PackageValidator` to use `GET_SIGNING_CERTIFICATES` along with
the new fields in `PackageInfo`.

Change-Id: I4a34680a7872d9c93ff680080382872589c5b8f7

Update dependency versions.

Change-Id: If3248300c6277042f18ad44c918aa5b9c4e1978f

Update ExoPlayer to 2.9.0

ExoPlayer 2.9.0 includes automatic handling of audio focus, so in
addition to updating ExoPlayer, we also removed the
AudioFocusExoPlayerDecorator class, which is no longer used.

Change-Id: I19e4dda27d9ce89d67e36a763729295db3671ffe

Revert "Add base feature module and move app code there"

This reverts commit 61d2e0ba5e2a5a5519c93a4d7059cd863f9c8cc1.

Reason for revert: Instead of using base feature plugin, we will use app bundles

Change-Id: I9e3584734e541646f7b7dc39170c2a2e8cee8dc6

Add base feature module and move app code there

This is a precursor to platform-specific modules that can now depend
on a base feature module.

Change-Id: I98945cc2ef5bdb55fe292201c2b81031bfa0c773

Fix GitHub issue #250

MusicService wasn't getting started, leading to a situation where the
service would be killed and the ExoPlayer playback thread would continue
to play queued songs until it was also killed or it completed the queue.

This change ensures the service is started when playback begins so that
the client may unbind without service being killed immediately.

Change-Id: Ib4a846c2e60d3f0644b0b5843d1815dbd3caef68

Updates for PackageValidator.

- Simplify checks to make each opportunity for an app to connect be more
clear.
- Add ability to whitelist apps that hold certain permissions (such as
MEDIA_CONTENT_CONTROL.
- Add missing license & fix minor typo.

Change-Id: I6153175c5b8854e290c63f670b713df63c0814f3

Add signature verification.

This adds code to verify the signature of apps that are connecting to
the MediaBrowserService to allow returning a limited/empty set of
results, or blocking other apps from connecting.

Change-Id: I17ff7672acb6d1d97fef52f0934b7c0d6d789fab

Fix for #231

This is a temporary fix for an issue where the metadata of the
currently playing item isn't updated when the player is stopped.
This change just makes sure that, if the player isn't "prepared"
(buffering, playing, or paused), it will send `playFromMediaId()`
rather than `play()` when selecting an item.

Change-Id: I35d1ea625c286f67eedad95062980b834443cf4e

Fix for Github issue #233

On certain versions of Android, UAMP would throw an IllegalCharsetNameException
when trying to encode a URL using "UTF-8" for the character encoding.
In order to prevent the exception, add a check for UTF-8 support, and
if it is not supported, fallback to the default encoding.

Change-Id: I9aff8fff91eb41c1da013be0e5027d131b5417f4

Use RecyclerView payloads.

- Fix a bug where the code for `DiffUtil.ItemCallback<MediaItemData>`
  was incorrectly flagging items that were the same as being
  different, causing the UI to flash each time an item in the
  list of media items was interacted with.
- Add code for `getChangePayload` to further improve the UI response
  by notifying when the only change is the playback resource changing
  (from pause<->play, or either of those to null (0)).
- Add comment explaining the reasoning for why `getChangePayload`
  uses the algorithm it does.

Change-Id: Ic816a85d0a8145c1a7ae7251b34560c7824e2434

Ensure metadata is propagated.

This change works around a peculiarity in the ExoPlayer media session
extension and how metadata is propagated.

By including a download status, MediaMetadataCompat will create an
"extras" bundle, which will then be included when retreiving
its MediaDescriptionCompat (with `.getDescription()`)

This in turn allows the placing of *all* of the metadata from
the MediaMetadataCompat into the MediaDescriptionCompat that
`.getDescription()` returns, which is then passed along to the
media session as one would expect.

This should fix the issue of album art not appearing on the
lockscreen: GitHub issue
[#227](https://github.com/googlesamples/android-UniversalMusicPlayer/issues/227).

Change-Id: I924dfd8caf0166e60b9d405e769d8cfa7f2351dc

chosen queue started playing.

it is a new media item.

is recreated in PAUSED state, the latest position is shown.

didn't get properly set.

Bug: 18820011
Bug: 18819432

Change-Id: Ia590465acb40d1c368fd2dd4299f95baca8ffd23

Fix handling of back button in fragment/activity

The issue was that a fragment was being restored by the framework on
orientation changes. Such a fragment would show nothing since its onStart()
returns if the mediabrowser is not connected. This was compounded by the
fact that onConnected() in the activity was adding a new fragment on each call.

This fix does the following:
1. Moves the code that should be run when a MediaBrowser is connected into
a method named onConnected()
2. Changes the Activity to start with a fragment if savedInstanceState is null.
3. Changes the connectionCallback of the activity to call the fragment.onConnected()
4. Finally it handles the case where a new fragment is added when the browser is already
connected => onStart() called onConnected()

Change-Id: Id41b9dfec2b46e87892032a6260721eb136264d3

Integrate Cast Playback into uAmp.

1. Introduce an interface for Playback that is used for playing on both
   local as well as remote devices.
2. Refactor local media playback and move it into LocalPlayback
3. Add a Playback implementation for Cast that supports sequential playback using CCL.
4. Also add the CCL aar updated with the following fixes:
   a. Use executeOnExecutor for reconnection logic
   b. Use CopyOnWriteArraySet for listeners to address the concurrent modification exception
      caused by adding a listener inside a listener method such as onApplicationConnected(..)
